major: Digital Systems and Design, Bachelor of Science and Master of Science (Technology)
description: Digital Systems and Design will make you an expert at the intersection between electrical engineering and design, with the hands-on skills to lead in your field.

major: Chemical Engineering, Bachelor of Science and Master of Science (Technology)
description: Embark on a journey in chemical engineering. Designed for those passionate about innovation, sustainability, chemistry and problem-solving.

major: Computational Engineering, Bachelor of Science and Master of Science (Technology)
description: In Computational Engineering, you’ll learn to simulate the behaviours of physical objects, fluids and gases to solve real-world problems.

major: Data Science, Bachelor of Science and Master of Science (Technology)
description: In Data Science, students dive into the foundations of our knowledge society where the demand for data science professionals is ever-growing.

major: Computer Engineering, Bachelor of Science and Master of Science (Technology)
description: In Computer Engineering, you’ll dive deep into hardware and software infrastructure to become a leading innovator in the future of AI & IoT.

major: Quantum Technology, Bachelor of Science and Master of Science (Technology)
description: Dive deep into quantum technology to master new computing, communication, and sensing paradigms that will define the future of technology.

major: Electronics and Nanotechnology, Master of Science (Technology)
description: By developing modern hardware technology, electronics and nanotechnology experts play a key role in shaping the future.

major: Health Technology Engineering, Master of Science (Technology)
description: Health Technology Engineering is a rigorous programme for engineering-minded students eager to innovate and impact the healthcare field.

major: Biological and Chemical Engineering for a Sustainable Bioeconomy (Bioceb), Master of Science (Technology)
description: As the first European joint programme focusing on bioeconomy, the Master’s Programme in Biological and Chemical Engineering for a Sustainable Bioeconomy (Bioceb) trains future research and innovation managers leaping to the forefront of the sustainable development movement. They are well-prepared for tackling global challenges like climate change mitigation and the preservation of biodiversity.

major: Space Science and Technology, Master of Science (Technology)
description: SpaceMaster V is a continuation of the original Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree programmes launched in 2004 and implemented by a consortium of leading European universities in close collaboration with research and industrial organizations.

major: Zero Defect Manufacture for a Circular Economy (EIT), Master of Science (Technology)
description: Zero Defect Manufacture for Circular Economy (ZD) is a combination of studying manufacturing science, data analysis, and process management. Master's Programme in Manufacturing is an international double degree programme supported by EIT Manufacturing. The programme includes studying in two different countries and a minor in Innovation & Entrepreneurship.

major: Data Science - ICT Innovation (EIT Digital Master School), Master of Science (Technology)
description: The Data Science Master’s offers a unique two-year academic programme, where students study data science, innovation and entrepreneurship at two different leading European universities.

major: Human-Computer Interaction - Computer, Communication and Information Sciences, Master of Science (Technology)
description: By creating user-friendly next-generation computing products, HCI experts help society make the most out of revolutionary technologies.

major: Building Technology, Master of Science (Technology)
description: Building technology is at the core of designing and constructing both safe and sustainable living environments of tomorrow.

major: Urban Studies and Planning, M.Sc in Architecture
description: A diverse group of students with different backgrounds is inspiring. Every teacher has a different expertise and some different perspective to bring to the discussion, and the topics we learned broadened my knowledge of the city from very different perspectives.

major: Human-Computer Interaction and Design - ICT Innovation (EIT Digital Master School), Master of Science (Technology)
description: The Human-Computer Interaction and Design (HCID) master’s programme is an interdisciplinary programme where our User-Centred Design approach places the users at the centre of the design process. By combining human aspects to technological and business aspects, we create new products and services with great usability and user experience.

major: Advanced Materials for Innovation and Sustainability (EIT Raw Materials), Master of Science (Technology)
description: Students will acquire an understanding of the full raw materials value chain and create a mindset for innovation and entrepreneurship focusing on sustainability. The programme covers the following themes: substitution of critical or toxic materials in products and for optimized performance, material chain optimization for end-of-life products, and product and service design for the circular economy.

major: Mathematics and Operations Research, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The unparalleled problem-solving power and predictive capability of mathematics and statistics enable profound and sustainable solutions to even the most complex problems. The programme educates top mathematical problem solvers with strong analytical skills and explicit knowledge of logical reasoning.

major: Water and Environmental Engineering, Master of Science (Technology)
description: To ensure sustainable and functioning societies, the world needs engineers specialised in solving local and global water-related challenges.

major: Spatial Planning and Transportation Engineering, Master of Science (Technology)
description: Making smarter and more liveable cities requires new skills that integrate land use and transportation. The Master's Programme in Spatial Planning and Transportation Engineering offers the skills you need to design and develop urban and regional systems.

major: Geoinformatics, Master of Science (Technology)
description: Master's Programme in Geoinformatics turns students' talent and hard work into excellence. After graduating, you will be able to work effectively in many roles in society, applying and utilizing current knowledge of geoinformatics.

major: Computer Science - Computer, Communication and Information Sciences, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The major Computer Science is grounded in leading-edge computing research at Aalto University, which is routinely ranked among the top 10 Computer Science departments in Europe.

major: Maritime Engineering (Nordic Master), Master of Science (Technology)
description: The Master program in Maritime Engineering is concentrated on ships, including yachts and offshore structures, their design, construction and operation and their interaction with the environment.

major: Game Design and Development - Computer, Communication and Information Sciences, Master of Science (Technology)
description: A unique mix of artistic and technical aspects in game design and development, grounded in Nordic game dev culture and the latest research.

major: Additive Manufacturing for Full Flexibility (EIT), Master of Science (Technology)
description: Master's Programme in Manufacturing and its Additive Manufacturing for Full Flexibility major are a combination of production science, mechanical design and production management.

major: Software and Service Engineering - Computer, Communication and Information Sciences, Master of Science (Technology)
description: Software and Service Engineering is the backbone of modern society and economy. The Master’s programme in Computer, Communication and Information Sciences – Software and Service Engineering equips students with some of the most sought after skills in today’s job market, across a wide range of industries.

major: Communications and Data Science, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The Communications and Data Science Double Degree Programme covers a range of timely, industry topics relevant to modern fields of engineering. Communications and Data Science is a two-year master's programme, with student mobility between Aalto University, Grenoble INP Graduate schools of Engineering and Management at Université Grenoble Alpes, or Técnico Lisboa at Universidade de Lisboa.

major: Life Science Technologies, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The Master's Programme in Life Science Technologies educates a new generation of engineers, researchers and entrepreneurs who are committed to improving human health and wellbeing through development of innovative scientific and engineering solutions. The programme has a strong focus on the technological aspects of Life Sciences.

major: Cold Climate Engineering (Nordic Master), Master of Science (Technology)
description: Visit the Arctic and gain a unique specialisation in cold climate engineering. Boost your CV by studying abroad. Graduate with a double degree from two internationally acclaimed universities.

major: Industrial Engineering and Management, Master of Science (Technology)
description: What opportunities do new technologies bring about for companies? How can the necessary changes be implemented? How to motivate employees to embrace change as a leader? The Industrial Engineering and Management (IEM) programme answers these questions while educating future leaders and changemakers.

major: Communications Engineering - Computer, Communication and Information Sciences, Master of Science (Technology)
description: In our digitally revolutionised world, the ability to develop, build, and maintain networks is in greater demand than ever before.

major: Automation and Electrical Engineering, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The programme prepares students to perform in the intersection between hardware and software, with applications in energy, robotics, and biomedical engineering.

major: Energy Conversion Processes - Advanced Energy Solutions, Master of Science (Technology)
description: Focuses on short- and long-term solutions to global energy challenges using expertise in thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, and renewable energy systems.

major: Architecture - Architecture, Landscape Architecture and Interior Architecture, Architect, Master of Science
description: Architecture is technical and artistic, it is a social art and also an artful science.

major: Industrial Energy Processes - Advanced Energy Solutions, Master of Science (Technology)
description: Interested in a career in energy for our society? The Industrial Energy Processes and Sustainability major gives students an understanding of industrial energy processes.

major: Hydrogen and Electric Systems, Master of Science (Technology)
description: Integrating hydrogen solutions into energy systems is among the most important steps on the path to carbon-neutrality.

major: International Design Business Management, Master of Science (Technology) (School of Science)
description: IDBM integrates design and technology with global business development. The programme prepares students as the next generation of creative professionals.

major: Autonomous Systems and Intelligent Robots - ICT Innovation (EIT Digital Master School), Master of Science (Technology)
description: From self-driving cars to robotic assistants, the future is autonomous, requiring both an understanding of technology and the ability to evaluate autonomous processes.

major: European Mining Course, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The need of mineral-based materials is growing globally, partly related to the new green technology. Applications like windmills and electric vehicles require both traditional and high-tech metals for a sustainable future.

major: Speech and Language Technology - Computer, Communication and Information Sciences, Master of Science (Technology)
description: Aalto University’s Speech and Language Technology major integrates machine learning and speech technology, preparing graduates for careers in this growing field.

major: Cloud and Network Infrastructures and High-Performance Computing - ICT Innovation (EIT Digital Master School), Master of Science (Technology)
description: The programme focuses on cloud computing, smart connectivity, and digitalization, preparing students for the future of Industry 4.0, autonomous vehicles, and urban infrastructure.

major: Creative Sustainability, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The Master’s Programme in Creative Sustainability focuses on solving complex sustainability challenges in design, business, and materials and chemical engineering.

major: Engineering Physics, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The Master’s Programme in Engineering Physics equips students with a profound understanding of physics and mathematics, with a focus on research. It is closely connected to the Department of Applied Physics at Aalto University.

major: Acoustics and Audio Technology - Computer, Communication and Information Sciences, Master of Science (Technology)
description: This major focuses on human hearing, audio perception, and the physics of sound, preparing students to reduce noise pollution, plan harmonic environments, and design sound experiences.

major: International Design Business Management, Master of Science (Technology)
description: IDBM integrates design, technology, and global business development. Students tackle real-life business challenges provided by industry partners, preparing them as creative professionals.

major: Bioproducts Engineering, Master of Science (Technology)
description: This programme focuses on converting bio-based resources into recyclable bioproducts, a crucial skill for the future.

major: Geoengineering, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The Master's Programme in Geoengineering offers world-class education in geotechnics, rock mechanics, and construction. The programme is essential for creating sustainable built environments.

major: Mechanical Engineering, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The programme covers diverse fields like Arctic Technology, Mechatronics, and Marine Technology, offering flexibility to students in pursuing their interests within mechanical engineering.

major: Innovative Sustainable Energy Engineering (Nordic Master), Master of Science (Technology)
description: The programme combines renewable energy engineering with innovation and entrepreneurship, offering a double degree and world-class education in sustainable energy.

major: Sustainable Urban Mobility Transitions (EIT), Master of Science (Technology)
description: The programme focuses on sustainable urban mobility systems, integrating study, design, and evaluation of inclusive and resilient urban environments.

major: Smart Systems Integrated Solutions SSIs, (Erasmus Mundus), Master of Science (Technology)
description: A joint master’s programme with full student mobility between Aalto University, University of South-Eastern Norway (USN), and Budapest University of Technology and Economics (BME) with a focus on Smart Systems and Microsystems Technology.

major: Information Networks, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The programme educates innovators with human-centric technological skills and offers a comprehensive understanding of the interaction between people, technology, and business.

major: Machine Learning, Data Science and Artificial Intelligence - Computer, Communication and Information Sciences, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The programme focuses on Machine Learning, Data Science, and AI, equipping students with knowledge to solve 21st-century problems, including climate change and epidemic analysis.

major: Energy in Buildings and Built Environment - Advanced Energy Solutions, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The programme focuses on efficient energy use in building technology and aims to address global warming and healthy indoor climate issues.

major: Energy Systems and Markets - Advanced Energy Solutions, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The programme explores sustainable, smart, and flexible energy systems, with a focus on energy sources, production, markets, and transmission.

major: Real Estate Economics, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The programme prepares students for careers in real estate markets, investments, management, and development, addressing global urbanisation and construction demands.

major: Environmental Engineering (Nordic Master), Master of Science (Technology)
description: Environmental technologies and green engineering are fast-growing fields, offering innovative solutions for sustainable futures.

major: Signal Processing and Data Science - Computer, Communication and Information Sciences, Master of Science (Technology)
description: Learn to extract valuable data, discover patterns, and make predictions for smarter, more environmentally friendly devices.

major: Environomical Pathways for Sustainable Energy Systems (SELECT), Master of Science (Technology)
description: This joint double-degree program prepares students for real-world energy challenges with sustainable energy solutions.

major: Urban Studies and Planning in Real Estate Economics, Master of Science (Technology)
description: A challenging master’s program for ambitious students to lead urban growth and real estate development in 21st-century cities.

major: Biotechnology, Master of Science (Technology)
description: Biotechnology experts contribute to diverse industries like chemical and food, advancing a carbon-neutral bioeconomy.

major: Chemical and Metallurgical Engineering​, Master of Science (Technology)
description: The program focuses on environmentally responsible process design and development across all industries.

major: Doctoral Programme in Chemical Engineering
description: The programme includes six research fields, offered by the Departments of Bioproducts and Biosystems, Chemistry and Material Science, and Chemical and Metallurgical Engineering.

major: Aalto Doctoral Programme in Science
description: This multidisciplinary programme combines science, technology, and business, with research aimed at tackling complex societal challenges in areas like energy, environment, and health.

major: Aalto Doctoral Programme in Engineering
description: The programme covers seven research fields, including civil engineering, energy technology, and geoinformatics, with doctoral studies available in all the School of Engineering's departments.

major: Aalto Doctoral Programme in Electrical Engineering
description: This programme offers multi-disciplinary research in areas such as electrical engineering, energy, robotics, and biomedical engineering, supported by a strong foundation in mathematics and natural sciences.

major: Design and Media, Bachelor of Arts and Master of Arts (Art and Design)
description: Design is not just linked to physical objects, but also digital experiences and abstract concepts, shaping future products, services, and systems in a creative and critical manner.

major: International Business, Bachelor of Science (Mikkeli) and Master of Science (Otaniemi) (Economics and Business Administration)
description: The Bachelor’s Programme in International Business equips students with skills and knowledge to build and lead companies globally. This degree opens up a variety of career opportunities across industries.

major: Economics, Bachelor of Science and Master of Science (Economics and Business Administration)
description: The Economics programme provides tools and knowledge to understand and explain current global phenomena from an economic perspective.

major: Marketing, Master of Science (Economics and Business Administration)
description: Modern marketers are creative, strategic thinkers who navigate the digital landscape with effortless agility and intuition.

major: Accounting, Master of Science (Economics and Business Administration)
description: The Accounting programme prepares students for managing financial and non-financial information to help in planning and decision-making.

major: People Management and Organizational Development, Master of Science (Economics and Business Administration)
description: This programme equips students with expert knowledge and skills in human resource management and organizational development.

major: Information and Service Management, Master of Science (Economics and Business Administration)
description: The ISM programme shapes students into future leaders with expertise in leadership, business, and technology.

major: Global Management, Master of Science (Economics and Business Administration)
description: The programme prepares students for decision-making roles in a globalized environment, covering leadership and cross-cultural understanding.

major: Creative Sustainability, Master of Science (Economics and Business Administration)
description: This programme equips students to address global sustainability challenges through business leadership.

major: International Design Business Management, Master of Science (Economics and Business Administration)
description: IDBM integrates design and technology with global business development, preparing students for creative professional roles.

major: Economics, Master of Science (Economics and Business Administration)
description: The programme develops in-depth economic expertise and analytical skills to tackle global challenges like climate change and inequality.

major: Sustainable entrepreneurship, Master of Science (Economics and Business Administration)
description: This programme prepares students to lead sustainable business ventures and address urgent global issues.

major: Strategic management in a changing world, Master of Science (Economics and Business Administration)
description: This programme focuses on developing strategies in a rapidly changing world with an emphasis on sustainability and digitalization.

major: Finance, Master of Science (Economics and Business Administration)
description: This programme focuses on financial markets, risk management, and addressing global challenges in the finance field.

major: Business Analytics, Master of Science (Economics and Business Administration)
description: The Business Analytics programme provides leadership, business, and technology expertise with a focus on data-driven decision-making.

major: Business, Economics and Finance
description: The Aalto Doctoral Programme in Business, Economics and Finance is a four-year, English-language doctoral programme with three specialization areas: Business, Economics and Finance.
